examples: The entrapment of the victims in the wreckage made rescue difficult.

definitions.definition: Action by law enforcement personnel to lead an otherwise innocent person to commit a crime, in order to arrest and prosecute that person for the crime.
examples: A detective asking you to buy illegal marijuana for a dying man would be police entrapment .

definitions.definition: A method of isolating specific cells or molecules from a mixture, especially by immobilization on a gel.

secondary_definitions: ( law ) Action by law enforcement personnel to lead an otherwise innocent person to commit a crime, in order to arrest and prosecute that person for the crime.
( chemistry ) A method of isolating specific cells or molecules from a mixture, especially by immobilization on a gel.
